name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: Principal AI Engineer - Conversational AI & Mobile Chat Experience
professional_summary: I am having 10 years of experience in Conversational AI and mobile chat application development, specializing in voice-enabled, action-oriented bots for regulated industries like banking and insurance.

Using Amazon Lex to address complex natural language understanding challenges in insurance claims processing, implemented multi-turn dialog flows with secure slot filling that reduced customer service calls by significant margin.

Leveraging AWS Lambda and DynamoDB to build serverless conversational architectures for real-time insurance policy inquiries, enabling instant customer self-service while maintaining data privacy compliance.

Implementing Amazon Connect integration for voice interaction capabilities in mobile insurance applications, allowing customers to seamlessly transition from chat to human agents during complex claim scenarios.
Developing action-oriented bots capable of processing insurance transactions securely, incorporating ASR and TTS technologies to create intuitive voice-first experiences for mobile users.
Applying secure coding practices and accessibility standards across all conversational AI implementations, ensuring insurance applications meet WCAG guidelines and protect sensitive customer data.
Designing conversational experiences with robust context management and session handling, enabling personalized insurance recommendations based on customer history and preferences.
Building CI/CD pipelines for conversational AI systems using Jenkins and GitHub Actions, automating testing and deployment of Lex bots while maintaining insurance regulatory compliance.
Integrating ML models from Amazon SageMaker with Lex chatbots to enhance intent classification accuracy, improving insurance product recommendation relevance and customer satisfaction.
Creating distributed tracing and monitoring dashboards for conversational systems, quickly identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks in real-time insurance chat applications.
Implementing PII masking and encryption protocols within DynamoDB tables, ensuring sensitive insurance customer information remains protected throughout conversation flows.
Developing mobile SDK integrations for voice capture and permissions management, enabling seamless voice-enabled insurance claim reporting through native iOS and Android applications.
Architecting multi-agent systems using Crew AI and LangGraph frameworks for complex insurance workflows, coordinating specialized bots for claims, policies, and customer service tasks.
Building RAG pipelines with vector databases to provide contextual insurance information retrieval, enhancing chatbot responses with accurate policy details and coverage explanations.
Implementing dialog orchestration patterns for handling insurance escalation scenarios, smoothly transferring context from automated bots to human agents when needed.
Designing secure authentication flows with OAuth and MFA for insurance transaction processing, ensuring only authorized users can perform sensitive actions through conversational interfaces.
Optimizing ASR and TTS workloads through batching and caching strategies, reducing latency in voice-based insurance applications while maintaining natural conversation flow.
Conducting rigorous testing of conversational agents using utterance regression validation, continuously improving insurance bot accuracy and handling edge cases effectively.
